text: Cassipourea is a genus of flowering plants in the family Rhizophoraceae. There are about 40 species.Mesta, D. K., et al. (2009). Cassipourea ceylanica (Gardn.) Alston (1925) (Rhizophoraceae) in Karnataka. Journal of Threatened Taxa, 1(10), 530-532. The genus is divided into several subgenera, based mainly on the structure of the flowers.Kenfack, D. (2011). Cassipourea atanganae sp. nov., a new species of Rhizophoraceae from Lower Guinea. Adansonia, 33(2), 209-213. Species include: * Cassipourea acuminata Liben * Cassipourea brittoniana Fawc. & Rendle * Cassipourea eketensis Baker f. * Cassipourea fanshawei Torre & Goncalves * Cassipourea flanaganii (Schinz) Alston * Cassipourea hiotou Aubrev. & Pellegrin * Cassipourea obovata Alston * Cassipourea subcordata Britton * Cassipourea subsessilis Britton * Cassipourea swaziensis Compton * Cassipourea thomassetii Alston ==References== Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Cassipourea
